content.description:
Space Walls is your standard chimney climb. Climb the chimney with classic offwidth and chimney style moves until you reach a large ledge with multiple belay options.

To descend, exit through the cave to the left and follow the descent for

Shetland Ponies

.
content.protection: Multiple wide cams from 3" and up.
content.location:
Walk down the hill/around the corner South from

Shetland Ponies

for about 100 feet to a very obvious chimney that looks like it goes all the way to the top of the formation.

content.description: This is a short climb with a low crux. Start on top of a pedestal just beneath a low angle, left-leaning crack in a right-facing dihedral. Walk straight back from the climb until it meets the hillside.
content.protection: Gear from 3" - 6". Belay with a couple hand-sized pieces.
content.location:
It is the furthest north line on the cliff and is just left of an offwidth crack and

Shetland Ponies

.

climbs.name: Shetland Ponies
climbs.fa: Daniel Hassell and Jacob Martin. May 9th, 2020

content.description:
Climb the right-angling crack with hands and fists up to a ledge on the corner. Round the corner, and continue up easy ground over a wide crack to a large ledge. Gear belay with 3-4" cams in the horizontal crack to the right. Toproping is not recommended.

To descend: go left from the top of the climb, and hop down a couple ledges. Downclimb a short 5.5 hand crack in a corner, landing you at the top of '

Shoot Low, Boys!

', and go right on the ledge until it meets the hill side.
content.location:
This is on the Northernmost part of the west-facing wall. Locate a right-leaning crack that begins on the same pedestal as an offwidth, about 30 feet to the right of '

Shoot Low, Boys!

'.

content.description: Stand start. Levitate off the ground, and thrutch your way to the top. A sit start variation is possible.
content.protection: One pad or a really good spotter.
content.location: It is the obvious, offwidth boulder problem at the top of the approach slab.

content.description: Climb a brief but quality splitter from hands to 5", and top out. If the crack were longer, it would get more stars. This could be a boulder problem, but the landing is so bad that a fall could be catastrophic.
content.location: From the Boof Crack Boulder, scurry down towards the main formation, and turn right in the gully, stepping down towards the edge of a large boulder. The crack is above on the wall across from the main formation.
